skills.name: Write 5 digit numbers and above as words
Express words as 5 digit numbers and above
Use inequality notation to order integers with the same number of digits

explanations.A: One of these statements is not true. Remember the open side of the inequality symbol will face the larger number.
explanations.B: I think you have confused the direction of the inequality symbols. Remember the wider/open part of the inequality symbol will face the larger number.
explanations.C: 472 is greater than 427, which would be written as 472 > 472. 250 is less than 360, which would be written as 250 < 360.
explanations.D: One of these statements is not true. Remember the open side of the inequality symbol will face the larger number.

explanations.A: One of these statements is not true. Remember the open side of the inequality symbol will face the larger number.
explanations.B: 351 is greater than 315, so 351 > 315. 140 is less than 410, so 140 < 410.
explanations.C: I think you have confused the direction of the inequality symbols. Remember the wider/open part of the inequality symbol will face the larger number.
explanations.D: One of these statements is not true. Remember the open side of the inequality symbol will face the larger number.

explanations.A: One of these statements is not true. Remember the open side of the inequality symbol will face the larger number.
explanations.B: 1030 is less than 1300, which would be written as 1030 < 1300. 1030 is greater than 1003, which would be written as 1030 > 1003.
explanations.C: I think you have confused the direction of the inequality symbols. Remember the wider/open part of the inequality symbol will face the larger number.
explanations.D: One of these statements is not true. Remember the open side of the inequality symbol will face the larger number.

explanations.A: One of these statements is not true. Remember the open side of the inequality symbol will face the larger number.
explanations.B: I think you have confused the direction of the inequality symbols. Remember the wider/open part of the inequality symbol will face the larger number.
explanations.C: 2060 is less than 2600, which can be written as 2060 < 2600. 2060 is greater than 2006, which can be written as 2060 > 2006.

explanations.A: The 2 is in the hundred thousand column, so is worth two hundred thousand. The 3 is in the ten thousand column, so is worth thirty thousand. Therefore, the number is two hundred and thirty thousand.
explanations.B: Consider the place value columns that each digit is in, and what they are worth.
explanations.C: Consider the place value columns that each digit is in, and what they are worth.
explanations.D: Consider the place value columns that each digit is in, and what they are worth.

explanations.A: Consider the place value columns that each digit is in, and what they are worth.
explanations.B: Consider the place value columns that each digit is in, and what they are worth.
explanations.C: Consider the place value columns that each digit is in, and what they are worth.
explanations.D: The 5 is in the hundred thousand column, so is worth five hundred thousand. The 4 is in the ten thousand column, so is worth forty thousand. Therefore, the number is five hundred and forty thousand.

explanations.A: Consider the place value columns that each digit is in, and what they are worth.
explanations.B: Consider the place value columns that each digit is in, and what they are worth.
explanations.C: Consider the place value columns that each digit is in, and what they are worth.
explanations.D: The 5th column from the right is the ten thousands column, so there would be a 4 in this place for 'forty thousand.' The second column from the right is the tens column, so there would be a 2 in this place for 'twenty'. Therefore, forty thousand and twenty would be 40,020.

explanations.A: Consider the place value columns that each digit is in, and what they are worth.
explanations.B: Consider the place value columns that each digit is in, and what they are worth.
explanations.C: The 5th column from the right is the ten thousands column, so there would be a 6 in this place for 'sixty thousand.' The second column from the right is the tens column, so there would be a 7 in this place for 'seventy'. Therefore, sixty thousand and seventy would be 60,070.
explanations.D: Consider the place value columns that each digit is in, and what they are worth.

explanations.A: Consider the place value columns that each digit is in, and what they are worth.
explanations.B: Consider the place value columns that each digit is in, and what they are worth.
explanations.C: The 6th column from the right is the hundred thousands column, so there would be a 1 in this place for 'one hundred thousand.' The first column on the right is the units column, so there would be a 9 in this place for 'nine', giving 100,009.
explanations.D: Consider the place value columns that each digit is in, and what they are worth.

explanations.A: The 6th column from the right is the hundred thousands column, so there would be a 3 in this place for 'three hundred thousand.' The first column on the right is the units column, so there would be a 6 in this place for 'six', giving 300,006.
explanations.B: Consider the place value columns that each digit is in, and what they are worth.
explanations.C: Consider the place value columns that each digit is in, and what they are worth.
explanations.D: Consider the place value columns that each digit is in, and what they are worth.
